message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CR, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY 

The paper discusses a new threat in which a recommender system learns private attributes of users who do not voluntarily disclose them. This involves designing both passive and active attacks that solicit ratings for strategically selected items, and could thus be used by a recommender system to pursue this hidden agenda. The methods are based on a novel usage of Bayesian matrix factorization in an active learning setting. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), and cs.CY (Computers and Society).
